summary.para: Associates content (owned by the caller) with the compositor, assigns a composition device to the content, and specifies the position of the content in the composition tree relative to other composition visuals.

param.name: content
param.para: The content to add to the composition tree.
content is placed between parentVisual and childVisual in the composition tree.

param.name: device
param.para: The device used to compose the content.
Note device is created by the application.

param.name: parentVisual
param.para: The parent visuals in the composition tree of the content being added.
parentVisual must also be a parent of childVisual in the composition tree.

param.name: childVisual
param.para: The child visuals in the composition tree of the content being added.
parentVisual must also be a parent of childVisual in the composition tree.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method inserts a small visual tree (owned by the Direct Manipulation device) between the parentVisual and the childVisual. Transforms can then be applied to the inserted content.

All content, regardless of type, must be added to the compositor. This can be primary content, obtained from the viewport by calling GetPrimaryContent, or secondary content, such as a panning indicator, created by calling CreateContent.
If the application uses a system-provided IDirectManipulationCompositor:

item.description: device must be an object, and parent and child visuals must be objects.
device, parentVisual, and childVisual cannot be NULL.
device, parentVisual, and childVisual objects are created and owned by the application.

When content is added to the composition tree using this method, the new composition visuals are inserted between parentVisual and childVisual. The new visuals should not be destroyed until they are disassociated from the compositor with RemoveContent.

remarks.para: If the application uses a custom implementation of IDirectManipulationCompositor:

item.description: device, parentVisual, and childVisual must be a valid type for the compositor. They do not have to be or objects.
device, parentVisual, and childVisual can be NULL, depending on the compositor.

summary.para: Commits all pending updates in the compositor to the system for rendering.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method enables Direct Manipulation to flush any pending changes to its visuals before a system event, such as a process suspension.

param.name: content
param.para: The content to remove from the composition tree.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method removes content added with AddContent and restores the original relationships between parent visuals and child visuals in the composition tree. In other words, RemoveContent undoes AddContent.

summary.para: Sets the update manager used to send compositor updates to Direct Manipulation.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Call this method during Direct Manipulation initialization to connect the compositor to the update manager.

summary.para: Represents a compositor object that associates manipulated content with a drawing surface, such as canvas (Windows app using JavaScript) or Canvas (Windows Store app using C++, C#, or Visual Basic).

remarks.para: The content of a Direct Manipulation viewport must be manually updated during an input event for custom implementations of IDirectManipulationCompositor. Call Update to redraw the content within the viewport.
